title: Ship AVX2 mkl .so files with wheels
body_html:
Here is the code causing the segmentation fault:

import torch
import torch.nn as nn
import torch.nn.functional as F
from torch.autograd import Variable as Var
#import Constants
import numpy as np
import random
class dc_model(nn.Module):
    def __init__(self):
        super(dc_model, self).__init__()
        self.projection = nn.Linear(193, 2)
if __name__ =='__main__':
    model =  dc_model()
    variance = Var(torch.randn(3000, 193))
    print(model.projection(variance))

Here is the gdb trace

Actually, this program run smoothly on my own PC, but meet segmentation fault on the gpu server. So I'm afraid there might be wrong configuration or dependency error. Anyone can help? Thanks very much!
body_text:
Here is the code causing the segmentation fault:
import torch
import torch.nn as nn
import torch.nn.functional as F
from torch.autograd import Variable as Var
#import Constants
import numpy as np
import random
class dc_model(nn.Module):
    def __init__(self):
        super(dc_model, self).__init__()
        self.projection = nn.Linear(193, 2)
if __name__ =='__main__':
    model =  dc_model()
    variance = Var(torch.randn(3000, 193))
    print(model.projection(variance))

Actually, this program run smoothly on my own PC, but meet segmentation fault on the gpu server. So I'm afraid there might be wrong configuration or dependency error. Anyone can help? Thanks very much!
body:
Here is the code causing the segmentation fault:
```
import torch
import torch.nn as nn
import torch.nn.functional as F
from torch.autograd import Variable as Var
#import Constants
import numpy as np
import random
class dc_model(nn.Module):
    def __init__(self):
        super(dc_model, self).__init__()
        self.projection = nn.Linear(193, 2)
if __name__ =='__main__':
    model =  dc_model()
    variance = Var(torch.randn(3000, 193))
    print(model.projection(variance))
```
